page.title: 05TOURISM
page.content:
Walton began as a victorian seaside town. But over the years it has expanded into a commercial centre for tourism. There has always been a tradition for families to come to Walton for holidays. Over the last 15 years the caravans have increased by 500 to 1900 caravans based at the Martello and South Cliffs caravan parks.
In the past few years factors which account for the attraction of Walton include natural and commercial advantages such as : the pier, which is the second largest in Britain; amusements; water sports; attractive sandy beaches and waters; public houses; local clubs and relatively warm climate compared with the rest of Britain. It has an average temperature of 17 degrees centigrade {
